file_content.text: I am the Vengeful One. You have killed many for wealth. You will kill more for me.
I am the Vengeful One. You have killed many for personal gain. You will kill more for me.
My millennia-old quest is over. Now I drift into oblivion....
The Breeder's creations have paid for their master's transgression--the ground is awash with their blood. You have carried out my vengeance well.
Of course I did.
What's next?
There is no more killing to be done--I am satisfied with my revenge.
My reward?
You have fulfilled your end of our bargain. Claim your reward and I will have fulfilled mine.
The need for vengeance is over--I am the Vengeful One no more.
Destroy the Breeder's monstrous spawn. Only then will I have my vengeance.
I have waited a thousand lifetimes for one such as you. Let us speak.
I am the Vengeful One. You have killed many for power. You will kill more for me.
I am the Vengeful One. You have killed many for your Empire. You will kill more for me.
Only I decide whose blood I spill.
No one tells me who to kill.
I take or spare lives at my own discretion.
No one tells me who to kill.
I don't pull the trigger unless I have a reason to, pal.
No one tells me who to kill.
I'll pick my own targets, thank you.
No one tells me who to kill.
You misunderstand. I seek to bargain, not compel.
Vengeful One?
A prisoner of thought and void.
These bodies... did you do this?
What happened here?
The Esh-kha sought my hoard, yet refused to bargain with me. Do not make their mistake.
Long have I dreamt of revenging myself upon my captor--the Breeder, my people called him. But death claimed him eons ago.
The Breeder's legacy lives on through the twisted monsters that stalk these jungles. He lived only to create, and the beasts were his greatest achievement. You must destroy them.
Why should I risk my neck to help you?
I'll need a reason first.
I can give you the power to surpass your peers and rivals.
Your profession is death--I will help you dispense it more freely.
Your Empire would gain much from what I offer.
I can give you the means to destroy any who stand against you.
Why did this Breeder put you in there in the first place?
Why were you imprisoned?
I no longer dream of the "why"... in truth, I have forgotten. What matters now is vengeance.
If I were you, I wouldn't be satisfied with killing a few animals.
That's hardly revenge.
I would kill the Breeder a thousand times if I could--but he is beyond my reach. His pets shall die in his stead.
The adjacent vault contains a cache of powerful weapons not seen since the pinnacle of the Infinite Empire.
My terms are simple: Exterminate the Breeder's creations, and the vault's contents are yours.
I'm always interested in new means to crush my enemies.
New weapons? You got it.
Blood for power--my kind of bargain.
New weapons? You got it.
You get your revenge, I get some new toys. Deal.
New weapons? You got it.
Such weaponry could be a valuable asset to the Empire.
New weapons? You got it.
Then we have an accord.
You'd better not go back on your word.
Fine, but I don't trust you.
I have no reason to cheat; beside my vengeance, all else is immaterial.
You will find the Breeder's creatures hunting in the outlying jungles. They are ancient, unnatural predators. Kill them swiftly.
No deal. [Refuse quest]
I have waited an eternity for my retribution. I will wait longer, if I must.
You do not have the strength I require. Leave me.
